data.text: Passengers whose flights have been cancelled can of course rebook free of charge or receive a refund on request. Passengers can check the status of their flight on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under “My Bookings”.

Corona🦠Update: Austrian Airlines has to cancel 20% of all flights in the continental network in the month of March. This affects the entire route network within Europe, inner-Austrian connections are also affected. However, all destinations will continue to be served. https://t.co/tIMOBFYgbA

data.text: From 8th November we will take off from the new Berlin airport #BER. As of now we move Berlin bookings from #TXL to #BER. data.text: CCO Andreas Otto: “The spread of the #Coronavius and the economic effects are hitting the tourism industry hard. Companies are cancelling business trips, placing travel bans or imposing short-time working. We have to react to the drop in demand by reducing routes.” https://t.co/vKtjEg0FRZ

Passengers who provided their telephone number or e-mail address during the booking procedure as well as members of the frequent flyer program Miles & More will be informed automatically via SMS or e-mail of flight changes.

Passengers whose flights have been cancelled can rebook free of charge or receive a refund on request. Austrian asks all passengers who have booked an Italy connection in the affected period to check the status of their flight on https://t.co/YLEBDoRZ3z under “My Bookings”.

#Coronavirus: Austrian is experiencing a sharp drop in demand within Europe and above all to Italy. 40% of the offer to Italy in March and April will be cancelled. This contains frequency reductions on the routes from Vienna to Milan, Venice, Bologna, Florence, Rome and Naples. https://t.co/qWnfXsPkR7

data.text: As our A320 fleet expansion progresses the Dashs are gradually leaving us. Last Monday we had to say goodbye to our #GolfFoxtrot. We wish you a good onward journey and thank you for all the years of reliable service! 🙏🛫 https://t.co/gZVQkTyDGQ
It is VIE-LAX indeed. Almost everybody got it absolutely right, thanks for all your responses! 🙏👍
Can you guess where our longest non-stop flight goes to? 🤔 #Servus https://t.co/WU7NO8VDNd

Last Saturday our #BravoFoxtrot had a special assignment: As charter OS 2631 she flew from Linz to Kittilä, Finland - a great place to ski, for example in Levi. Kittilä is also famous for having recorded the lowest temperature in Finnish history: −51.5 °C 🥶 #TuesdayThoughts https://t.co/iLFznOuWeo

data.text: The safety of our passengers and employees is our top priority. After a thorough evaluation of all currently available information on the Corona Virus, we have decided to suspend our flights to and from China until the end of the winter flight schedule on 28 March 2020. https://t.co/0TlJZBgfeG

entity.name: French journalists show life in China amid the coronavirus outbreak
entity.description: Correspondents based in China for French news publications Le Figaro, Les Echos and France 2 have been reporting from the frontlines of the coronavirus crisis in Wuhan as well as from the capital city Beijing. Their photos and videos highlight the Chinese government's response to the outbreak, the nouveau "ghost towns" and the measures people are taking to avoid catching the illness.

data.text: In addition to new appointments, the reorganization of the management of Austrian Airlines will reduce hierarchical levels. In close consultation with the Works Council, 30% of all Management Positions will be eliminated. About 90 out of 300 executive positions will be cut. https://t.co/setRpxN8KY

Susanne Svejda, also an experienced manager from the company’s own ranks, will succeed Markus Christl. Up until now the 38-year-old manager has been Senior Director Operational Steering & Support and therefore among others responsible for our Hub Control Center at Vienna Airport. https://t.co/4q6nsCsDuC

Markus Christl (48), currently Head of Ground Operations and thus responsible for the global ground handling of the national carrier, will take charge of all personnel-related issues for Austrian Airlines starting on March 1, 2020. https://t.co/Rgj72HnS0e

The current Accountable Manager Jens Ritter (46) will be appointed Chief Operations Officer and be part of the extended Executive Board. He has already been responsible for a major part of operations of the red-white-red national carrier since February 2016. https://t.co/WUja64Znin
New managers have been appointed in the areas of Human Resources and Ground Operations. Several areas of the company will be merged, and management levels will be reduced. https://t.co/Tq1BXd5rBI

data.text: During the last few weeks we have brought you closer to the world of flying and Austrian Airlines with our #AustrianABC 🔤✈️ On this week’s #AustrianBlog you will find the whole summary! #Servus https://t.co/hBilC7KpRB https://t.co/VG8EOpfgyW

On #ThrowbackThursday let's fly back to the year 1969 and take a look at our beautiful Boeing 707, which was used on our Vienna - New York route 📸🛫 That's pure nostalgia. What do you think? #TBT https://t.co/Q5bWfM0u31

data.text: Always know where to go, communicate easily all over the world or counteract your jet lag in advance? No problem with our 10 travel app recommendations on the #AustrianBlog! 📲 Come along and be prepared for your next trip! ✈️ #Servus https://t.co/87yQfYklvk https://t.co/odNqIAA2pl
Beauty! 😍 https://t.co/pZ3PKfcUWi

Wie kann man 10.000 Essen am Tag herstellen, sodass sie auch schmecken? Dazu hat sich #Flightcast in die Küche von Do & Co in #Wien begeben, um die Entstehung eines Menüs vom Lieferanteneingang bis zum Flugzeug-Trolley zu begleiten: https://t.co/F8GxxIwJTO https://t.co/aC4d25YBQR

When it's getting tight with the transfer we have a unique service here at Vienna Airport driving passengers and luggage from one plane to the other so they catch their connecting flight. As you can see, we have been doing this for a while now. 😉 #Tbt #TBThursday https://t.co/AQ8FRcBlPc

data.text: Did you know that there's a big "Servus" on every belly of our planes? This means "Hello" in traditional Austrian dialect. We want to greet the world wherever we are flying to! 😉👋#WednesdayWisdom https://t.co/asVriAZaxY

domain.name: Reoccurring Trends
domain.description: Twitter generated Trends that occur on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis such as Monday motivation.

data.text: You have Dash material from the last 40 years? Then it would be great if you could post it as reply to this tweet. We are especially looking for photos but also personal stories, memories and special experiences in connection with our Dash. Huge thanks in advance! 🙏 https://t.co/mzp4Tywz24

40 years ago the first Dash 7 joined Tyrolean Airways, which became a subsidiary of Austrian Airlines in the 90ies. Many fond memories are linked to this aircraft type. Since our current Dash models are gradually leaving us, we want to document their history and need your help! https://t.co/CZnCro1Zvs
Huge thanks to @marleenpirchner for these great pics ... and also for getting up so early! 😅
What a beautiful #TuesdayMorning on the way to Geneva! https://t.co/4amiKpnNce

data.text: Thanks to @Flugthier for this great pic! A shot to be proud of! 😉👍

data.text: "I am pleased, that we are among the most punctual airlines in Europe again. However, there is still room for improvement", says Austrian Airlines CEO @AHoensbroech. "Punctuality is as important to us as the red-white-red on our planes." https://t.co/jUiFGYqPJO

In 2019, Austrian Airlines was once again among the most punctual airlines in Europe. This is confirmed by a recently published study by the travel data and analytics expert @cirium. 79 percent of all arrivals were on time. That means 10th place in the ranking. https://t.co/vs00s4lyyj

data.text: In 1996 we celebrated the year of the Millennium (in 996 the name "Austria" was mentioned for the first time). For this we painted famous Austrians from the last 1000 years on an A321: Sigmund Freud, Empress Elisabeth (Sissi) and of course Mr. Mozart. 🇦🇹 #ThrowbackThursday #TBT https://t.co/PALjs8peDj

data.text: Unfortunately, the typo devil struck again: The increase in punctuality was 1.1 and not 11 percentage points. Sorry about that. We are nevertheless pleased with the improvement.
© @alexcheban
HUD guiding us HOME. 😎 #TuesdayMotivation @embraer https://t.co/fxB48PSKlR

data.text: It's time for the last #AustrianABC! Today we explain more about "Z", the second letter in the tail number of our new Airbus airplanes. #Servus 🛫🇦🇹👋🏻 https://t.co/zN4mF65rUa

In spite of a denser flight program, Austrian Airlines was able to improve its operational stability considerably in 2019. The number of punctual departures rose by about 10.8 percentage points to 76.6 percent. Over 99 percent of all scheduled flights were also operated. https://t.co/nacu9LNyjj

With about 14.7 million passengers in 2019, Austrian Airlines succeeded in setting a third passenger record in a row surpassing the previous all-time high of 2018 by 5.1 percent. Capacity utilization equaled 80.8 percent, an increase of 1.6 percentage points and a new record too. https://t.co/ZEd7lMsOjs

Eis 🧊 kann gefährlich sein. Und alles was gefährlich ist, mögen wir gar nicht. Die Enteisung ist jenes Mittel die Gefahr zu bannen. Wie „De-Icing“ funktioniert, hat #Flightcast in einem Gespräch mit dem obersten Eismeister des @flughafen_wien erfragt: https://t.co/u1Da1LNiDq https://t.co/TScIbnStCY
We regret the inconvenience for our passengers, but we do not compromise on safety.

Austrian Airlines Security continues to evaluate the situation on site together with Lufthansa Group Security and national and international authorities. As soon as we have detailed information, we will decide whether and when our Iranian flights can be operated again.

data.text: Due to the latest reports and the changed assessment of the security situation for the airspace around Tehran airport, Austrian Airlines has cancelled the rotation OS 871/OS 872 to Tehran until incl. January 20.

As soon as we have detailed information, we will decide whether and when our Iranian flights can be operated again. We regret the inconvenience for our passengers, but we do not compromise on security.

The aircraft will return to Vienna after the stop in Sofia. Austrian Airlines Security continues to evaluate the situation on site together with Lufthansa Group Security and national and international authorities.

data.text: Due to the latest reports and the changed assessment of the security situation for the airspace around Tehran airport, Austrian Airlines has cancelled today’s and tomorrow‘s rotation OS 871/OS 872 to Tehran. Austrian planned to operate today‘s OS 871 with a stopover in Sofia.
